2. What is the function of a Ruffini receptor?
answers: To detect skin stretching. | To detect pressure on the skin. | To detect changes in temperature. | To detect movement

text: 3. Holly pours herself a cup of tea and spills it on herself, and she quickly pulls her arm away. Which one of the following is responsible for her reaction?
answers: Primary Sensory Endings. | Secondary Sensory Endings. | Cutaneous Receptors. | Muscle Spindles.

text: 4. Which of these is NOT a function of joint angle receptors? There may be more than one correct answer.
answers:
Least active at extreme angles. |
They are rapidly adapting. |
They are not very sensitive in signalling precise joint angles. |
They are not sensitive to extreme angles. |

text:
5. Complete the sentence(s) below.

Intrafusal | are embedded in|. They are innervated by | and | endings that respond to changes of muscle length.
answers: muscle spindles | muscles | sensory endings | gamma motor

text: 6. What is the function of a Gamma Motor Neuron?
answers: It innovates the intrafusal fibres to match the muscle length. | It innovates the extrafusal fibres to match muscle length. | To detect pressure of the intrafusal fibres. | To detect stretch of the muscle length.

8. Complete the sentence(s) below.

| are slow adapting and are found at the | of the muscle fibre and react to changes of muscle |.
answers: Secondary sensory endings | tail endings | length
